newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Fifty Buenos Aires province cops fired.
newsitem.headline: Fifty Buenos Aires province cops fired.

text.p: Some 50 police officers from Buenos Aires province were fired on Thursday, a week after Gov. Eduardo Duhalde put the entire force on notice they could be fired due to charges of corruption and brutality.
The private DyN news agency quoted the province's Security Secretariat as saying all 50 agents, including four precinct chiefs and two deputy chiefs, had legal proceedings against them.

Last week, Buenos Aires Gov. Eduardo Duhalde, a 1999 presidential hopeful, summoned 1,000 top officers for a dressing-down and a warning that he was putting all 48,000 agents in the force that he was putting them on "dispensable" status, meaning they could be fired.

His threat followed a series of probes showing massive corruption in the provincial force and opinion polls revealing widespread popular fear of the police -- a scenario which analysts say could thwart Duhalde's presidential ambitions.

Officers have been caught trafficking drugs, four have been indicted for involvement in a 1994 bomb attack on a Jewish centre that killed 86 people and there has been case after case of police brutality ranging from beatings to youngsters killed by trigger-happy officers.
